file_content.text: If you see Colonel Darok, tell him "hi" for me... with your fist.
Theron--they made it! I knew it.
We cannot wait forever!
All right, all right... we'll be there right away, Jakarro. Just don't tear the limbs off of anything. Anything else.
Hey, it's good that you're here. Our "friends" are eager to get started.
Get started with what, exactly?
Colonel Darok, Darth Arkous, and their Revanite friends.
Since your operation on Manaan, Lana's uncovered a few more Revanites who've infiltrated the Republic military.
I've been slicing the traitors' communications, and tracked the messages back to Darok and Arkous. They're in a hidden facility on the planet Rakata Prime. That's our target.
Do you think the Revanites know you've found their hideout?
Are the Revanites on alert?
What do we know about Rakata Prime?
Tell me about the planet.
No more cloak-and-dagger stuff. Let's get the biggest weapons we can and blast them into dust.
I want to vaporize them.
That kind of hardware isn't easy to come by. The Revanites will notice if we start collecting turbolasers and orbital strike bombs. We need to catch them by surprise.
The messages I've decoded... that cyborg technology you ran into on Manaan was just the prototype phase. On Rakata Prime, they're in full production.
They're taking pieces of the Star Forge and implanting them into their own people.
The Star Forge?
It was a Rakatan weapon: a giant self-sustaining factory that ran on the dark side of the Force. Revan destroyed it three hundred years ago.

The pieces of debris are still active, though. They self-repair and even self-replicate under the right circumstances. With that technology grafted to their bodies, the Revanites become much harder to stop.
It sounds like the longer we wait, the more of these cyborgs they'll have. Let's get moving.
Then we'd better hurry.
Reminds me of Rakata technology that I dealt with on Tatooine. Nasty stuff.
I saw similar tech on Tatooine.
Cyborgs or not, they aren't invincible. I proved that on Manaan.
Harder--but not invulnerable.
True enough.
Jakarro's freighter should get us onto the planet's surface undetected. We'll plan our attack from there.
Things are going to get worse before they get better....
Sensors are showing a lot of movement in the temple. The Revanites are mustering their defenses.
Look for a control console and open a channel there--I'll be able to slice into their systems remotely.
We're seeing movement on the temple roof--might be Darok and Arkous trying to make an escape.
Incoming fire is too heavy--we can't get to you!
With the amount of fire Revan's ship was laying down... I wasn't optimistic. It's good to see you.
Forget all that--my ship had better be in one piece!
Oh no, I'd nearly forgotten! Several of my internal components were still aboard--the ship is all right, isn't it?
The ship is fine, come see for yourself. There's something we need to talk about, actually....
It truly is a relief to see you safe. I only wish we had more time together....
What's going on? Are you leaving already?
What do you mean?
It's for the best.
I'm not going anywhere, Lana. You don't have to, either.
[Flirt] Then let's make time.
I'm afraid I do.
I'm sure you'd love to spy on us a bit more, but oh, look at the time!
Leaving? Good riddance.
That isn't what I meant at all.
Theron and I learned some... troubling things after we escaped Rakata Prime.
Jakarro took it better than I thought. You told her yet?
Jakarro took the news better than you'd think. Have you told him?
I think it's best if you do the honors.
We'll meet again soon--I'm certain of it.
She's pretty confident for someone with a bounty on their head.
Are the Revanites putting out bounty contracts now?
Not directly, no. It's an Imperial contract, for murdering Arkous. Under any other circumstances, she would've gotten a promotion for that kind of thing.
They also arranged twelve separate death marks for Jakarro. That's a new record for him.
And you?
"Disavowed rogue agent, apprehend on sight." Pretty tame compared to the others. The Director must have stood up for me.
If you know the Director, couldn't he tell you who's behind this?
Ask him who framed you.
I checked. The evidence of my imaginary crimes came in from our internal security division, all very well forged. He'll keep looking, but we can't risk more contact.
Sounds like you're a dangerous man to be around.
[Flirt] "Rogue agent", huh?
That's why I have to go.
The Revanites haven't been able to touch you yet--your record is still clean. But it won't stay that way if you're seen working with us.
Lana, Jakarro, Deefour, and I are all going off the grid. We need to stay hidden if we're going to continue our investigation--no contact, period.
No contact at all, huh? Not even a little bit?
[Flirt] No contact?
The Revanites will be watching you, so do what you do best--travel the galaxy, achieve impossible things, and make it hard for them to keep up.
Why would you let the Revanites frame you? We know the charges are fake--stand up to them!
We shouldn't stand for this!
If you've found their base of operations, we may be able to end this threat before it goes any further.
Good work.
Let's hope so.
What are we talking, here? Recon, or assault?
How are we proceeding?
Assault--the sooner the better.
On a scale of one to ten, how suicidal is this one going to be?
More mortal danger!
No worse than usual. So maybe a twelve?
It's the homeworld of the ancient Rakata--hence the name. Apparently there are still a few of them there, but their society has regressed significantly.
The Revanites probably picked it because it was the site of a major battle involving Revan--one of his biggest victories.
Gladly.
I've seen Agent Fauler's reports on that one. It's good to know we're bringing along an expert.
I'm surprised they have so many volunteers. It must be a painful process.
Sounds... unpleasant.
They're insane cultists obsessed with the past. Giving them a chance to literally put pieces of history into themselves and become nearly unstoppable? There's probably a waiting list.
I can't wait to see the look on Arkous and Darok's faces....
Darok and Arkous are in there somewhere--just keep moving.
Looks like they've got a shuttle--we can shoot it down if we have to, but I'd rather take them in for questioning if you can. Hurry!
Find another ship! We'll meet at the safehouse on Manaan! Go!
That would take time, and we can't be sure of success. Finding Revan is much more important than clearing our reputations. Besides--we still have you.
What can I do while you're in hiding? There must be some way I can help with the search.
Is there any way I can help?
There is, actually.
You're much too worried about all of this, Theron. We should be sticking together, not scattering apart.
Splitting up is foolish.
Trust me. This will all go much better if we work separately.
The busier you keep the Revanites, the easier it will be for the rest of us to slip through the cracks and find their leader.
Consider it done.
I'll be sure they see just how much a Jedi is capable of.
Perfect.
I'll do my best to provide a better example than their fellow cultists.
Wouldn't hurt if a few of them had second thoughts.
If they want to try and keep up with Havoc Squad, they're in for a workout.
The tougher the better.
I haven't met anyone yet who could keep up with me, but I'll do my best to make it sporting for them.
Very gracious of you.
Do you think the masked man who attacked us was really Revan?
Do you think it's really Revan?
You mean, has my ancient ancestor returned from the grave to kill us all? It doesn't seem likely, but... there was something about him. We need to learn more.
Being your convenient diversion had better not get me killed.
Fine, I'll play decoy.
After everything you've gone up against, I really doubt this will give you much trouble.
All right, I'd better get moving--the faster we start running, the easier this will all be.
Good luck to you. We'll send word as soon as we have something--and then we'll see what this Revan guy is really made of.
No--not yet, at least. That's why we need to move quickly.
Let's get moving.
If we had more time... but we don't. There's something I need you to do for me.
Okay, that route is not working out like we planned.
You'll have to head along the beach and straight through Rakata central. Sorry.
No way around that rancor. I do not envy you.
Overheard some Revanites near your position. Came across a cache of Rakata-tech weapons. Might want to do something about that.
Look out, they put together a welcoming party for you. More of those cyborgs.
